item.title: ReorderList demo for AjaxControlToolkit
item.description: AjaxControlToolkit's ReorderList provides drag and drop functionality within a list. <div class="CssReorderList"> <!--ClientMode="AutoID" is required for certain versions of AjaxControlToolkit --> <ajaxToolkit:ReorderList ID="MyReorderList" runat="server" DataKeyField="MyId" SortOrderField="MyPosition" PostBackOnReorder="False" ClientIDMode="AutoID" DragHandleAlignment="Left" ItemInsertLocation="Beginning" AllowReorder="true" > <ItemTemplate> <div style="background-color: yellow;" class="CssItemArea"> <asp:HiddenField runat="server" ID="hdfMyId" Value="<%# ((DummyViewModel)Container.

item.title: Impressions during developing my first application with Mono and Gtk# (GtkSharp)
item.description: Why Mono? Why Gtk? Over the past couple of years I have been developing C# ASP.NET enterprise applications. So I am quite comfortable with the Microsoft stack. That answers the first question: Mono gives me C# and the .

item.title: Converting a Mercurial repository to Git
item.description: Note to self: Converting Hg repos to git using hg-fast-export. Installation: $ sudo aptitude install hg-fast-export Usage: $ cd new_git_dir $ git init $ hg-fast-export -r <hg-repo> Works with: git version 1.

item.title: Converting a Subversion repository to Git
item.description: Just discovered this: John Albin wrote an excellent article on how to convert a subversion repository to git: http://john.albin.net/git/convert-subversion-to-git

item.title: App.Config: Order matters
Rails and Emacs: Rsense and Auto-Complete
item.description: If you're developing Rails with Emacs and using Rinari here are two more extensions you might like: http://cx4a.org/software/auto-complete/ and http://cx4a.org/software/rsense/ Installation. Just as described. Code completion for ruby-on-rails with emacs!

item.title: Antivir regression bug makes Visual Studio 2010 unusable
item.description: The current version of Antivir Personal slows down Visual Studio 2010 making it unbearable to develop ASP.NET applications. Debugging with active Antivir: appr. 5min for an empty Default.aspx page to display.

item.title: NHibernate Simple Setup

item.title: Snippet for adding unknown files/dirs to Subversion (command line)
item.description: svn add `svn st | grep "^?" | awk '{print $2}'`

item.title: Installing SQL Server Management Studio 2008 Express after installing Visual Studio 2010
item.description: Visual Studio 2010 comes with its own version of SQL Server Express. If you try to install SSMS(E) (SQL Server Management Studio Express) afterwards and run into trouble, take a look at this post by Alexander Zeitler.

item.title: NHibernate Code Completion (IntelliSense) for Visual Studio
item.description: Enable code completion (IntelliSense) in Visual Studio by copying the XSD files from NHibernate to your Visual Studio's XML folder. For example (NHibernate 2.0.1): Files to copy: ${nhibernate-location}\NHibernate\2.0.1\nhibernate-configuration.xsd ${nhibernate-location}\NHibernate\2.0.1\nhibernate-mapping.xsd Destination:

item.title: Using a different minor-mode-prefix with Rinari (Emacs Rails)
item.description: Rinari is a Ruby on Rails Minor Mode for GNU/Emacs. Problem: Most key mappings / keyboard shortcuts rely on the hard coded strings ; and ' (I.e. C-; f c -> rinari-find-controller).

item.title: Eclipse3.5/Subclipse1.6.x asks for unnecessary SSH confirmation and details (solved)
My HelloWorld script for Maven
item.description: I'm still in the learning phase of using Maven, so bare with me. Here is my script to create an executable HelloWorld-jar file using Maven (it requires the file sample-pom.xml listed after the script):

item.title: Maven-eclipse-plugin 2.6 might break wicket projects
item.description: Took me a while to find this, so I thought I'll post it: Maven's eclipse plugin version 2.6 does not work well with Wicket projects. The problem with version 2.6 is that the Maven's folder structure does not conform to Wicket's folder structure.

item.title: Maven2 Heap Overflow in JUnit test cases: Howto increase memory
item.description: For the past few days I was wondering why Maven's install gave me a Heap Overflow exception on JUnit tests on some of my machines. I tried increasing the memory by using the environment variable MAVEN_OPTS, by passing the option “-Xmx512m” to the JVM through Eclipse and from the command line.
